Description: Fragment of oval handle from neck join to moderate turn of a Rhodian pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine red-brown. Rectangular stamp.
Curator's comments: Ink, worn. Name Rhodon. Rhodon I, of period I or II. From same die as Alexandria, Greco-Roman Museum, ABV 400.20.
Bibliographic references: Stoddart 1847 / Memoir on the inscribed pottery of Rhodes, Cnidus and other Greek Cities (236)
